name: Introduction to Art History
description: This course provides an overview of the history of art from a variety of cultures and time periods. It will cover the history of art from the Paleolithic period to the present day. Students will learn about the evolution of art styles, techniques, and materials throughout the centuries.

name: Drawing and Color Theory
description: This course will cover the basics of drawing and color theory. Students will learn the fundamentals of composition, light, shade, and texture. They will also learn how to mix and use color in their artwork.

name: Sculpture and Installation
description: This course covers the fundamentals of sculpture and installation art. Students will learn how to construct and install sculptures and other artwork in public spaces. They will also learn about the history and evolution of sculpture and installation art.

name: Public Art Theory and Practice
description: This course explores the history and theory of public art. Students will learn about the different types of public art, their purpose, and how to create public art. They will also gain knowledge of the legal, political, and social aspects of public art.
